item.title: The Curse of Knowledge: Steven Pinker’s Science of Good Writing
item.description: Why so much writing is unreadable, what Steven Pinker thinks we’re doing wrong, and how the curse of knowledge, abstraction, and rhythm sabotage clarity. A practical guide to better prose, rooted in cognitive science and style.

item.title: The M-Shaped Mind: Why Your Graveyard of Projects Is Strategic, Not Shameful
item.description: Why having many unfinished projects is not a personal failure but a rational strategy for resilience, creativity, and long-term relevance in an unpredictable world.

item.title: Game of Life | A Digital Universe
item.description: How four tiny rules create a digital universe of life, logic, and surprising complexity.

item.title: Meet the Puppet Master Living in Your Skull
item.description: A dive into Libet experiments, veto windows, and the neuroscience behind why your brain may be pulling the strings long before 'you' decide anything.

item.title: AI Doppelgängers Are the Hottest Thing Since the Sims
item.description: How researchers built AI doppelgängers from real people—scaling from a 25-agent Smallville to a 1,052-person behavioral simulation with eerily human accuracy.

item.title: DIY Home Project #472: Bubble-wrap the Sun with a Dyson Sphere
item.description: A fun dive into Dyson spheres, megastructures, solar swarms, and what it would take to bubble-wrap the Sun for unlimited power.

item.title: Longevity Escape Velocity
item.description: What is longevity escape velocity, who coined it, how close we are, and what science says about outrunning aging.

item.title: Digital Sundial
item.description: A 3D-printed digital sundial that uses sunlight to project digital-style numbers, exploring light, geometry, and ideas for more Edinburgh-friendly, motorised versions.
